title: Winnebago County deputy bitten, shot during search
content:
ROCKFORD - Two Winnebago County Sheriff's Department deputies on Thursday accidentally shot a fellow officer as they opened fire on a dog that had attacked as they executed a search warrant at a residence in the 1100 block of Sunset Avenue.
A deputy suffered a bite wound to the leg and was grazed by a bullet to a foot. He was treated at a local hospital and released and could return to work when he is cleared by a doctor next week, Chief Deputy Mark Karner said.
The deputy was bitten when the dog apparently broke free of a cage as police searched the residence. The deputy called for help and other officers opened fire, killing the animal.
The names of the deputies involved were not released.
Detectives investigated the incident and in consultation with police commanders determined that the officers followed department policy in the use of their firearms, Karner said.
They were returned to work immediately.
Significant amounts of heroin, cocaine and marijuana were seized, along with $5,000 in cash, Karner said.
The investigation is ongoing, he said.
